description.narrative: The project targets children and youth living and working on the streets in Nairobi and Kisumu, as well as rural and urban communities where children have a high risk of going to the streets. The project works through both curative and preventive ways. I t uses the street association model developed by Undugu Society of Kenya aiming at reforming street children into decent, honest and well-meaning citizens. The Model includes 4 stages of transformation, namely formation, capacity building, empowerment, an d disengagement. The preventive measures include supporting parents in parenting skills and sensitizing them to understand the importance of bringing up children in a safe environment away from the street. Teachers are trained to be able to identify pote ntial child rights violations and take up the appropriate action. The project also targets media houses to provide airtime for youths to share their views and to actively participate on various social issues affecting them.
